page.title: 02Taddington's Parish Church
page.content: The church was built of limestone about 1350.It serves the parishes of Taddington,Priestcliffe,Blackwell and Brushfield.It has a stone wall lectern stone sedilia seats and an old stone altar top set in the floor under the present wooden altar.One of the two fonts was recovered from the former Star Inn where it had been used for washing mugs!An older one is in the porch.The churchyard is big and part is cut for hay.It has a slender shaft which may be 1200 years old.You can see where tools have been sharpened on one side of it.Some of the older gravestones were made by a family of stonemasons who lived in what is now the old post office. The school pupils planted a beech sapling in 1984 to eventually replace a 200 year old beech tree near the tower.
